# Pull Request Template

<!--- Provide a concise description of this PR. --->

## Summary

- What: Describe what this PR changes.
- Why: Short reason / motivation.

## Type of change
- [ ] feat: new feature
- [ ] fix: bug fix
- [ ] docs: documentation only changes
- [ ] style: formatting / no functional change
- [ ] refactor: code change that neither fixes a bug nor adds a feature
- [ ] test: adding or updating tests
- [ ] chore: build / tooling / maintenance

## How to test

- Steps to reproduce or run the project to verify this change.
- Example: `python day_1/firstlesson.py`

## Checklist
- [ ] My code follows the repository style guidelines
- [ ] I have performed a self-review of my code
- [ ] I added tests where applicable and they pass
- [ ] I updated documentation if necessary
- [ ] I used a semantic commit message (see README) for related commits

## Related issues
- Closes # (issue number) — if applicable

## Screenshots (optional)
- Add screenshots or logs if they help reviewers

---
Please keep PRs small and focused when possible — one logical change per PR helps reviewers.
